title: Textile, 17th century
medium:
Medium: silk
Technique: 7&1 satin weave with weft floats bound in 1+3 twill
dimensions: Warp x Weft (selvedge to selvedge): 91.4 x 54 cm (36 x 21 1/4 in.)
description: White figures on a pinkish-brown ground depicting the emblems of the Passion of Christ. The emblems include the cross, nails, crown of thorns, cock, ladder, bag of silver, cat o' nine tails, and sponge on a stick.  Both selvedges are present,  striped green and white satin.

tombstone.epitaph:
Textile, 17th century.
17th century. Medium: silk
Technique: 7&1 satin weave with weft floats bound in 1+3 twill. Gift of John Pierpont Morgan. 1902-1-845.
